data.title: GL Crash on latest Xamarin.Android
data.body:
This is likely another Xamarin bug, but I found this gem after updating to the latest Xamarin software today:

10-22 16:17:52.601 E/BufferQueue( 1997): [SurfaceView] queueBuffer: fence is NULL
10-22 16:17:52.601 E/Surface (23453): queueBuffer: error queuing buffer to SurfaceTexture, -22
10-22 16:17:52.601 E/[EGL-ERROR](23453): void __egl_platform_queue_buffer(mali_base_ctx_handle, egl_buffer*):1301: unable to queue buffer (0x67964700)
10-22 16:17:52.621 E/Error in swap buffers(23453): OpenTK.Platform.Android.EglException: EglSwapBuffers failed with error 12301 (0x300d)
10-22 16:17:52.621 E/Error in swap buffers(23453):   at OpenTK.Platform.Android.AndroidGraphicsContext.Swap () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
10-22 16:17:52.621 E/Error in swap buffers(23453):   at OpenTK.Platform.Android.AndroidGameView.SwapBuffers () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
10-22 16:17:52.621 E/Error in swap buffers(23453):   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.AndroidGamePlatform.Present () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
10-22 16:17:52.666 E/Error in swap buffers(23453): OpenTK.Platform.Android.EglException: EglSwapBuffers failed with error 12301 (0x300d)
10-22 16:17:52.666 E/Error in swap buffers(23453):   at OpenTK.Platform.Android.AndroidGraphicsContext.Swap () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
10-22 16:17:52.666 E/Error in swap buffers(23453):   at OpenTK.Platform.Android.AndroidGameView.SwapBuffers () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
10-22 16:17:52.666 E/Error in swap buffers(23453):   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.AndroidGamePlatform.Present () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 

Someone reported a similar issue back in April:

https://bugzilla.xamarin.com/show_bug.cgi?id=10569

No resolution apparently. The result of this after a minute or so of game play:

10-22 16:17:58.726 I/mono-stdout(23453): Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.MonoGameGLException: GL.GetError() returned OutOfMemory
10-22 16:17:58.726 I/mono-stdout(23453):   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.GraphicsExtensions.CheckGLError () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
10-22 16:17:58.726 I/mono-stdout(23453):   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.GraphicsDevice+FramebufferHelper.BindFramebuffer (Int32 framebuffer) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
10-22 16:17:58.726 I/mono-stdout(23453):   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.GraphicsDevice.PlatformApplyDefaultRenderTarget () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 

boom!

data.title: Random Letterboxing/Black Bars on Kindle Fire
data.body:
Hi,

 We've noticed that sometimes when a Monogame game starts up on Kindle Fire, the bounds of the game area are shrunk slightly, and little black bars are added along the edges of the viewport. This happens maybe 1 out of 5 times that you start the game. We haven't noticed it on other platforms. If you force kill the app and then restart it, it usually starts working completely full screen again.

We are running the latest version of Monogame from Git.

data.title: Texture2D.FromSteam: loading png mixes some colors [windows] (includes workaround/solution)
Orientation Issue on Kindle Fire HD 6
data.body:
We are seeing an issue on the Kindle Fire HD 6, where a Monogame based game is not performing orientation changes correctly. The game will work in whatever orientation it is started in, ex. landscape, and work correctly if you flip it to the "opposite" of that same orientation. However, if you flip it to portrait, it will get frozen. The game won't appear to resize its screen, and it stops redrawing or responding to user input.

On the Kindle Fire HDX 7 Tablet, orientation changes work perfectly normally.

This is with the latest Xamarin, and latest (as of tonight) Monogame build.

data.title: Guide updated for Android
data.body: The message box does not show at all on Android. So, I fixed ShowMessageBox method and updated ShowKeyboardInput, which are now both similar to those on iOS. And you can open your game in Play store with ShowMarketplace method.

data.title: MonoGame iOS how to use .acc or .m4a
data.body:
I am currently developing an iOS MonoGame app. I dont want to use .mp3 file format for my songs due to the licensing issues. I have read many MonoGame developers say that one can use .acc or .m4a. I personally had zero success loading any of these formats with build action set to Content. I placed them in the Content folder but I keep getting the following exception:

```
System.Exception: Could not initialize an instance of the type 'MonoTouch.AVFoundation.AVAudioPlayer': the native 'initWithContentsOfURL:error:' method returned nil.

It is possible to ignore this condition by setting
```

And the MonoGame content project cant import them for processing, so am not sure what to do here. Any tips would be greatly appreciated.

data.title: Remove event observers that aren't doing anything
data.body: Follow up to #3099

data.title: Add reference inside ItemGroup for Universal App Template
data.body: Addressing #3101

Error when creating universal app from VS 2013.   Windows phone project is created but error on creating windows store project.

Image attached.
![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4262914/4690729/e3fd5710-56f7-11e4-8299-006abbdf28d6.png)

data.title: Strange landscape screen size on Galaxy Note3
data.body:
So today I tested my game on a Galaxy Note3. I have set the game orientation to sensor landscape. While it first appeared fine, I noticed that if I press the home button and then re-enter the app, the draw area gets squashed into about half the length of the screen. The 'fix' was to flip around the phone so to refresh the orientation which caused the game to render correctly again, but this didn't always work and sometimes it would just remain stuck like that (screenshot attached). Any ideas how to fix this?

In Activity1.cs

LaunchMode = Android.Content.PM.LaunchMode.SingleTask
ScreenOrientation = ScreenOrientation.SensorLandscape

And in Game1.cs

_graphics.SupportedOrientations = DisplayOrientation.LandscapeLeft | DisplayOrientation.LandscapeRight;

I am guessing that MonoGame has made the game turn into portrait mode since as you can see in the screenshot, many UI elements are not visible and the wide play button is squashed. The visible part is the bottom half of the UI and the upper is offscreen. So basically this is portrait orientation in a sideways fashion...

![564815171c_669x500](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3251763/4690632/baaa8136-56f1-11e4-8ce8-8273b3d0becc.JPG)

data.title: Remove GC.Collect() when receiving memory warnings
data.body: As stated in the comment, this is not MonoGame's job. The app should be responsible of this and MonoGame should do its job without unexpected hiccups. The most MonoGame should do is to Log a warning (and do this for Android as well if applicable).

data.title: Fix autorotate behavior during launch on iOS
data.body: This could cause orientation issues when launching on iOS. Strangely it was working fine on iOS 8 but caused issues on the upcoming iOS 8.1 (I suspect this might be the cause for some ppl having orientation issues, depending on what they do in their Game.Initialize)

data.title: PipelineTool delete key handling
data.body: While the cursor is within a textbox (eg, editing a property on a content item) pressing delete should NOT delete the selected content item but it currently does.

data.title: fx technique preprocessor defines
data.body: Looks like whatever custom parsing we do to support the .fx syntax for defining a technique / pass / etc is not setup to obey one or more of the following: #if, #elif, #endif. Alternately the problem could be that defines from the processor are not being passed down to this step.

data.title: Add a message explaining ProjectGuids to the definition files
data.body:
This adds a message right about `<ProjectGuids>` in the MonoGame projects.  There was some user confusion that project GUIDs were required configuration for Protobuild projects (see https://github.com/hach-que/Protobuild/issues/66).  This led to duplicate project GUIDs, which meant that one or more projects didn't show up the solution (because we use duplicate project GUIDs to detect multiple references to the same third-party project).

To reduce confusion for anyone else using Protobuild in their own project, this adds a message explaining that they're not required and are only used for backwards compatibility with existing users of MonoGame.

data.title: Fix Visual Unit Test Shutdown
data.body:
This PR is an attempt to fix the false failed visual unit tests.

I suspect we're exiting quick enough that the WM_QUIT isn't in the message queue in time to consume it.  This introduces a tiny delay into shutdown in hopes we can more reliably process the WM_QUIT.

data.title: ResolveRelativePath Fixes
data.body:
This PR builds on the work @lordoaty did in https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/3073.

It adds fixes for unix-like systems and includes a unit test that hopefully covers the gamut of possible paths we can get.

Fixes https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/3064.
Fixes https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/3041.

data.title: PipelineTool TreeView per-item feedback
data.body:
PipelineTool could use the treeview to indicate the following:

Modified item
Folder containing modified item
Missing item
Folder containing missing item
Item which failed to build (if a build has been run since the project was opened)
Folder containing item which failed to build

data.title: More TextureContent Improvements
data.body:
A few more improvements to `TextureContent` types.
- Fixed `MipmapChainCollection` to correctly enforce fixed sizes.
- Added `Texture3DContent` and `TextureCubeContent`.
- Added tests for the `Texture3DContent` and `TextureCubeContent`.
- Improved `GraphicsUtil.Resize()` quality.
- Added `ResizePowerOfTwo` test for `TextureProcessor`.

data.title: SpriteFont content build fails when processing 1 or 2 pixel wide letters
data.body:
The FontTextureProcessor calls `rect.Inflate (-1, -1)` on the following rectangle:
{X = 139 Y = 10 Width = 2 Height = 20}
Which will be turned into this:
{X = 140 Y = 11 Width = 0 Height = 18}
And that will make the bitmap creation fail:
`var newbitmap = new System.Drawing.Bitmap(rect.Width, rect.Height);`

XNA builds it just fine.

data.title: Content pipeline crashes when converting BGRA4444
Content pipeline project reference support
data.body:
We are trying to move to the new MonoGame Content Pipeline. To keep things tidy, we kept the contentproj files and use the builder and pipeline targets to build and copy content to the output.

However, I couldn't figure out where we could pass our custom content processors, compiled as .NET 4.0 AnyCPU class libraries. How can we use those?

data.title: Fixes for the Content Pipeline targets
data.body: Two fixes for the targets file to build correctly using Visual Studio.

data.title: Fixed missing GetThumbnail and GetAlbumArt
data.body:
Added missing Album.GetThumbnail and GetAlbumArt to platforms where it isn't implemented (throws NotImplementedException).

The diff is ugly because I had to shuffle some code:

``` C#
#if WINDOWS_PHONE || WINDOWS_STOREAPP
// Returns Stream (like XNA)
#elif IOS
// Returns UIImage
#elif ANDROID
// Returns Bitmap
#endif
```

to

``` C#
#if IOS
// Returns UIImage
#elif ANDROID
// Returns Bitmap
#else
// Returns Stream (like XNA)
#endif
```

data.title: Album GetThumbnail and GetAlbumArt stubs
data.body: Added missing Album.GetThumbnail and GetAlbumArt to platforms where it isn't implemented (throws NotImplementedException)

data.title: Add Universal App Template
data.body: Please review, this pull request is the addition for a Windows Universal App Template on top of MonoGame.

data.title: Texture2DContent Fixes
data.body:
This is a follow up to #3082.
- Fixed places that assumed `Texture2DContent.Faces` was an empty collection.
- Fixed `Texture2DContent.Mipmaps` to use `Faces[0]` as its backing field.
- Added initial `TextureContentTests`.

data.title: TextureProcessor Fixes and Tests
data.body:
This PR adds some fixes to the `TextureProcessor` as well as the start of some unit tests for it.
- Fixed mipmap generation from occurring on compressed textures.
- Fixed incorrect defaults in `TextureProcessor`.
- `Texture2DContent` was not correctly initializing the `Faces`.
- Fixed incorrect implicit operator in `MipmapChain`.
- Implemented `overwriteExistingMipmaps` in `TextureContent.GenerateMipmaps`.

data.title: PipelineTool does not show basetype processor parameters.
data.body: If a custom processor type derives from an existing processor which has editor-visible properties, eg, MyCustomTextureProcessor : TextureProcessor, then the parent type properties will not be visible in the PipelineTool but should be.

data.title: Android games do not resume when app switching (home button)
data.body:
This seems to be a problem that was addressed at some point, because there are discussions about it dating back to 2012, but is still prominent.

Whenever the player presses the home button, the game cannot be resumed.  More technically, any time the game goes through OnPause() and OnResume(), a blank screen is left. 
This interferes with App Switching, trying to show interstitial ads, and In-App Purchases.

I have created a GitHup repo illustrating this issue that can be found here:
https://github.com/mrEmo/ProblemGame/tree/master

I have also posted on StackOverflow since I do not know how to solve this problem. The question is here:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/26370468/monogame-android-cant-resume-game-blank-screen

Also, in the community forums:
http://community.monogame.net/t/monogame-onresume-bug-cant-resume-properly-gl-invalid-operation/1298

If there is anything I can do, let me know. Thanks!
